comment.author: 68439219@N06
comment._content: Harvard - Boston Aero Meet  Sept. 3 -13, 1910 Atlantic, Mass.  The Wright aircraft is a "transitional" model, retaining the dual forward elevators / canards ( that date back to the 1903 aircraft.) and adding wheels.  At the Harvard - Boston Aero Meet the letter "A" had two meanings, it designated the aircraft type ( Wright  biplane) but also was used  to identify Wright aviator Walter Brookins.(Harvard -Boston Aero Meet Program)
